Type-3, 0.8mm, 6L, Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), For DDR5 & LPDDR5x

Pcb Type: Type-3

Pcb Thickness: 0.8mm

Pcb Layer Count: 6

Category: Mainstream

Material: Standard Loss (SL)

Variant: For DDR5 & LPDDR5x

Type-3, 0.8mm, 6L, Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), For DDR5 & LPDDR5x

Type-3, 0.8mm, 6L, Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL) Tline Spec (Differential) Notes
Note
For CNVio3 signal, use S-ES spacing for CNVIo3 Tx-Rx spacing. For spacing between CNVio3 and non-CNVIo3 signals use S-non ES value and also refer to "CNVio Signal Routing Sequence and CLK-to-CLK Spacing Recommendation" Diagram in CNVio3 Section.

M*DSL3, 4SUSCLK, UFS Reference Clock88375375504555-0.233140.9973610.997361
M*DSL3, 4I3C, SPI0 Flash88250375504555-0.234332.4091410.997361
M*DSL3, 4XTAL, RTC882001775504555-0.235413.519960.003886
Type-3, 0.8mm, 6L, Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL) Tline Spec (Single Ended) Notes
Note
Based on Tline Spec (Single Ended) table recommendation, the CLK - Any (um) spacing requirement shall be applicable for: 1) CLK to DATA signals on similar signaling group 2) CLK to DATA signals from other signaling group 3) CLK to CLK signals from other signaling group For CLK to pseudo static signals, the spacing between the CLK to others can be relaxed and used the DATA - Any (um) spacing requirement. Example of pseudo static signal: RESET, ALERT, Chip Select (CS), Request (REQ), INTERRUPT, INIT.

DDR5

Interface: DDR5

Notes

Type-3, 0.8mm, 6L, Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL) DDR5 Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400 um. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.

Topology: SODIMM 1DPC Type-3

BI2500500500
BI500500

Tline Spec (Differential, Internal)

Type-3, 0.8mm, 6L, Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL) Tline Spec (Differential, Internal)
TraceTline TypeRoutingI/OTrace Width (um)Intra-Pair (um)S - ESS - Non-ESZ (Default)
M*SL12PCIe Gen 5949050050080

CNVio2

CNVio2 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch: 0.254 mm Total length mismatch: 0.381 mm
Length matching between Data and CLK lanes< 1.27 mm
Impedance of differential channelFor a differential channel transmission line impedance of 80 - 85 .
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). IO power rails with less than 5A max current can be considered for dual reference implementation. (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void reference plane for all component pads, for example AC caps as well as connector pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Max via stub length< 900 um
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#: 726825
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void reference plane for all component pads, for example AC caps as well as connector pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Voiding recommendation for thin stackupIt is recommended to void reference plane for all component pads, for example AC caps as well as connector pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recomended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Discrete component part size for thin stackupIt is required to use 0201 component size.

Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.381
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)Yes1.27

CNVio3

Description: Serial Time Encoded Protocol (STEP) is a non-NRZ, non-PAM signaling architecture, which is referred to as CNVIO3 in product design guidelines. CNVIO3 (STEP) uses pulse width modulation and operates at a lower fundamental frequency than NRZ for similar data rates. It is a DC coupled asynchronous bus having high bandwidth, low power and small exit latency from low power states. The current version of CNVIO3 has a data transfer rate of 12gbps to support the Intel WIFI7 integrated solution. CNVIO3 runs over same traces as CNVIO2 clock lanes (1 Tx clock and 1 Rx Clock). CNVIO3 along with rest of CNVIO2 interface operates as combo solution, allowing customers to use legacy WIFI6 products, or new WIFI7 modules. Reflections and crosstalk are the primary performance limiters and hence CNVIO3 requires a very clean channels.

CNVio Signal Routing Sequence and CLK-to-CLK Spacing Recommendation
CNVio CLK Breakout and Break-in Guideline
Module Down Pad Dimension and Voiding Requirements
M.2 Connector Pad Voiding Recommendation
CNVIo skip layer routing recommedation for DSL
CNVio3 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch: 0.178 mm Total length mismatch: 0.127 mm
Single ended equivalent impedance of differential channelFor a differential channel transmission line impedance of 80 - 85 , the equivalent required single ended transmission line impedance should be 45 - 50 .
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupVoid reference plane for all component pads such as AC cap, connector and module pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Recommended voiding depth: -For M.2 connector pads: >= 230 um to the closest ground reference layer -For module pads: >= 150 um to the closet ground reference layer
Number of vias allowed Max 2 vias.
Max via stub lengthMax via stub length is 0.215 mm.
Reference planeContinuous GND is required for microstrip line. Dual continuous GND is required for DSL.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
CNVio signal sequence and CLK-to-CLK-spacingIt is recommended to route CNVio CLK in between the data lanes.When not possible, extra CLK-to-CLK spacing is required. Refer to CNVio Signal Routing Sequence and CLK Spacing Guideline.
CNVio CLK BI routing guideCNVio CLK break-in (BI) at the device requires the same impedance as main route. No neckdown into pin field. Refer to CNVio CLK BI at Device Guideline for more details.
Module pad dimensionModule pad dimension is 0.4mm x 0.6mm. Refer to the Module Down Pad Dimension and Voiding Requirements diagram.
WiFi SpeedFor designs supporting both WiFi6 and WiFi7, the CLK signals must follow the CNVio (For Future Compatibility) guideline. Data signals also need to follow CNVio (For Future Compatibility) guideline as much as possible for consistency. CLK and Data of the same direction must be routed on the same layer and length matching requirement between CLK and Data must also be met.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#: 726825
Routing in DSL ConfigurationIf DSL configuration is used (If CNVIo traces are routed in layer 4, then layer2 and layer 5 are ground reference layers, layer 3 is the skip layer) a. Route CNVio data pairs in betwen CNVio TX clk and RX clk b. For any parallel/orthogonal routing in the skip layer above DSL routing, the parallel/orthogonal routing on the skip layer needs to be atleast 9mm away from the CNVIO clk traces. Refer to CNVio Skip layer routing recommendation for DSL.
Supported configurationsMS with no vias, MS with vias (max 2 vias), DSL (max 2 vias)
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch: 0.178 mm Total length mismatch: 0.127 mm
Single ended equivalent impedance of differential channelFor a differential channel transmission line impedance of 80 - 85 , the equivalent required single ended transmission line impedance should be 45 - 50 .
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void reference plane for all component pads, for example connector pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Recommend to provide a void of 230 um until the ground reference layer for connector pads.
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Number of vias allowed Max 2 vias
Max via stub lengthMax via stub length is 0.215 mm.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended for microstrip line. Dual continuous GND is recommended for strip line.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
CNVio signal sequence and CLK-to-CLK-spacingIt is recommended to route CNVio CLK in between the data lanes.When not possible, extra CLK-to-CLK spacing is required. Refer to CNVio Signal Routing Sequence and CLK Spacing Guideline.
CNVio CLK BI routing guideCNVio CLK break-in (BI) at the device requires the same impedance as main route. No neckdown into pin field. Refer to CNVio CLK BI at Device Guideline for more details.

2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.178
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)Yes1.27

M.2 Connector pin 18Pin 18 of the M.2 connector must be grounded on the motherboard side to prevent common mode coupling from the BRI signal onto CNVio3 signals, possibly resulting in functional failure of the CNVio3 bus.

Differential Clock

Differential Clock General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Routing in DSL configuration if DSL configuration is used (for ex: Differential Clock is in layer 4 and there are signals routed in L3, this is assumed to be DSL configuration). Avoid power or ground planes in layer 3 above Differential Clock signals. Prefer low speed/GPIO signals in layer 3 above Differential Clock signals.
Parallel routing in DSL configuration If signals are routed in same direction (less than 30 degrees between routing in layers 4 and layer 3), please refer to General Dual Stripline Routing Recommendations.
Criss-crossing signals in DSL configurationFor differential clock, recommended maximum number of criss-crossing signals is 15. If same signal criss-crossing twice, it is counted as 2 criss-crossings.
Differential Clock Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Clock Topology

PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Clock Topology Diagram
Differential Clock Shielding
PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen4 devices require 0.76 mm (30 mils) isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other Differential Clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm (20 mils).
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (follow standard GND ring/ shield guidelines for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx4Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
M3Trace45

Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen4 devices require 0.76 mm (30 mils) isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other Differential Clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm (20 mils).
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (follow standard GND ring/ shield guidelines for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines.

DP AUX Redriver Topology

DP AUX Redriver Topology Diagram
DP AUX Redriver Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
ESDOptional
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).
RedriverConsult redriver datasheet for Aux interconnect requirement. Some devices will monitor Aux traffic so require an Aux connection.
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification.

Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Standard Loss (SL)

Signal Group: Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

DP AUX Redriver Topology Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BODSL, MS, SL25
M1+M2+M3DSL, MS, SL450
M4DSL, MS, SL25
MSMS, DSL, SL100If required by redriver.

Max Length Total (mm): 450

Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2+M3+M4

DP AUX Retimer Topology

DP AUX Retimer Topology Diagram
DP AUX Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
ESDOptional
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).
RetimerConsult retimer datasheet for exact Aux channel implementation requirements.
Optional edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism may be needed to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification dependent on the retimer's Aux implementation.
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.

RetimerMaple Ridge
MUXPassive mux, HD3SS214 or equivalent.

Type-C AUX No Retimer Topology

Type-C AUX No Retimer Topology Diagram
Type-C AUX No Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
ESD/ EOSRefer to EMC chapter for parts recommendation. Optional.
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).
3.3 V GPIO AUX termination set based on USB Type-C plug orientation requirements. Nominal 3.3 V or 0 V.
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification.

Type-C AUX No Retimer Internal Cable Topology

Type-C AUX No Retimer Internal Cable Topology Diagram
Type-C AUX No Retimer Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
500 mm cable assembly75 - 100 including tolerance. Insertion loss -1.0 dB @ 1 MHz.
ESD/ EOSRefer to EMC chapter for parts recommendation. Optional.
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).
3.3 V GPIO AUX termination set based on USB Type-C plug orientation requirements. Nominal 3.3 V or 0 V.
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification.

RetimerHayden Bridge, Gothic Bridge

Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended. Cs cap is optional.

DP AUX Dual Mode Protection Circuit

DP AUX Dual Mode Protection Circuit
DP AUX Dual Mode Protection Circuit Notes
NoteDetail
Power railsPower rails which will turn off in S3-S5 sleep states.
Inverter voltage railsPowered from suspend rails.
VCC-A1.8 V
VCC-C3.3 V
U1I2C Voltage Level Translator, TCA9406 or equivalent.
Pass gate FETEnsure the body diode of the FETs are connected as shown in the figure.
Pass gate FET alternativeDevices such as a TTL compatible FET multiplexer/ demultiplexer.
R1 resistorOptional, 2.7 k 5%.
Rterm10 k for TCA9406. Rterm value is part dependent.
R2 resistor value2.7 k 5%. This is with the assumption of Rterm = 10 k for U1, to achieve 2.2 k of effective parallel resistance.
Effective parallel resistance of Rterm and R22.2 k 10%.
Inverter leakage currentMinimize leakage current of inverter closest to DP connector to maintain input voltage level due to 1 Mohm pulldown resistor.
C1 cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification .

DP Hot Plug Detect Implementation

DP Hot Plug Detect Implementation Diagram
DP Hot Plug Detect Implementation Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingRecommend 45 nominal trace impedance with reasonable noise isolation.
VCC1.8 V
R1100 k 5%
R2100 k 5%
Q1BSS138p or equivalent, 0.85 V < VGS threshold < 1.95 V, input capacitance < 1 nF.
ConnectivityEnsure to follow the vendor data sheet for any additional HPD connectivity requirements.
ESDOptional, 3.3 V tolerant.

Barlow Ridge Type-C and DP Aux Topology

Barlow Ridge Type-C AUX Topology Diagram
Barlow Ridge DP AUX Topology Diagram
Barlow Ridge Type-C and DP Aux Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
ESDRefer to EMC chapter for parts recommendation. Optional.
EOSRefer to Barlow Ridge Design Guide for parts recommendation (#736855).
Cs cap valueEdge rate control, 47 pF nominal. Optional.
C1, C2 cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).
Type-C AC coupling and termination For Type-C ports Barlow Ridge integrates the aux pull-up, pull-down and AC coupling capacitor. For DP port aux channel discrete parts are required as shown in the topology diagram.

eDP

eDP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias, and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Voiding of 0402 or smaller AC capacitors pads is not necessary.
Reference PlaneMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
eDP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25

eDP Auxilary Main Link Topology Diagram
eDP Auxiliary Main Link Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingRelaxation: Reference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
AC cap value 75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance.
Cable assembly75 - 100 including tolerance. Insertion loss -1.0 dB @ 1 MHz.

eDP HBR3 Main Link CTLE Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedMax 3 vias.
CMCRefer to Electromagnetic Compatibility chapter (Common Mode Choke Selection).Optional. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.
355 mm cable assembly (micro coaxial)Cable length: 355 mm for micro-coax with the following assumptions 25 mm assembly insertion loss >= -0.62 dB @ 4.05 Ghz 355 mm cable assembly insertion loss >= -5.1 dB @ 4.05 Ghz 80 - 100 ohms characteristic impedance including tolerance
Twisted pair cable assemblyRefer to "ADL_TwistedPair_CableSpec_eDP_TWP_Rev0p7" document #644925. This document describes the electrical parameter limits for the twisted pair cables assumed for this topology. It does not consider any EMI/ RFI risks.
TCON RX equalizationCTLE only.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
eDP HBR2 max lengthRefer to eDP HBR3 Main Link CTLE+DFE Topology recommendation for HBR2 Main Link Topology max length.

eDP Hot Plug Detect Implementation

eDP Hot Plug Detect Implementation Diagram
eDP Hot Plug Detect Implementation Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingRecommend 45 nominal trace impedance with reasonable noise isolation.
VCC1.25 V
R1100 k 5%
R2100 k 5%
Q1For panel implementing eDP HPD: BSS138p or equivalent (0.85 V < VGS threshold < 1.95 V, input capacitance < 1 nF) For panel implementing eDP LVHPD: RU1J002YN or equivalent (0.35 V < VGS < 0.8 V, input capacitance < 1 nF)
ConnectivityFollow the vendor data sheet for any additional HPD connectivity requirements.

HDMI DDI

HDMI DDI General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between pair to pair (inter pair)Within 13 mm (HDMI 2.1); 25 mm (HDMI 1.4).
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Voiding of 0402 or smaller AC capacitors pads is not necessary.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left no connected at the BGA ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission lines should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
Fiberweave notesMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Reference plane guidelines for ALS and CRLS topologiesMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
HDMI DDI Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes13
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0

HDMI Hot Plug Detect Implementation

HDMI Hot Plug Detect Implementation Diagram
HDMI Hot Plug Detect Implementation Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingRecommend 45 nominal trace impedance with reasonable noise isolation.
VCC1.8 V
R1100 k 5%
R2100 k 5%
Q1BSS138p or equivalent, 0.85 V < VGS threshold < 1.95 V, input capacitance < 1 nF.
ConnectivityEnsure to follow the vendor data sheet for any additional HPD connectivity requirements.
ESDRefer to Electromagnetic Compatibility chapter (ESD Diode Selection).Optional, 5 V tolerant.

HDMI DDC Topology

HDMI DDC Direct Connect Topology Diagram
HDMI DDC Buffered Topology Diagram
HDMI DDC Topology Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingTotal length from driver to HDMI connector is limited by spec capacitance limit of 50 pF including trace capacitance and discrete. Please refer to I2C section for calculation details.
Power railsPower rails which will turn off in S3-S5 sleep states.
VCC-A1.8 V
VCC-B5 V
VCC-C3.3 V
U1 I2C Voltage Level Translator, TCA9509 or equivalent.
R1 resistor10 k 5%
R2 resistor1.5 k 5%
Back drive current protectionMax capacitance for back drive current protection Schottky diode is 10 pF. Must use diode of Schottky type to minimize voltage drop.
I2C guidanceDDC signals follow I2C guidelines.
Alternative implementations Depending on the Active Level Shifter implemented the DDC implementation may vary. Please refer to the vendors requirements for any changes in implementation.
Active level shifter partFollow Active Level Shifter datasheet recommendation as SDA/SCL signals may be optional depending on the part requirements. Component may be removed from the topology diagram if SDA/SCL connections are not required.
ESDRefer to Electromagnetic Compatibility chapter (ESD Diode Selection).
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification .

NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedMax 3 vias.
CMCrefer to vendor guidelines for CMC and ESD and Max IL should be <1.15 dB @1.5 GHz and RL<-17 dB
ESDFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section (I/O-to-GND capacitance 0.35 pF). Optional if retimer has integrated ESD that meets discharge requirements.
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (tolerance 75 nF to 200 nF).
ALSPericom PI3HDX1204B1, Pericom PI3HDX1204C or equivalent. Refer to "Pre-Channel" section for length recommendations.
Max supported HDMI 1.4b TMDS data rate3.4 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 TMDS data rate6.0 Gbps
Retimer sideband communicationAny port configured to support HDMI must implement sideband communications via the DDC (I2C) channel associated with that HDMI port as defined in the Video BIOS Table (VBT).

PCIe Gen 1-3

Recommended GND Stitching Via Placement
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Toe and Heel GND Via Recommendation
PCIe Gen 1-3 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). IO power rails with less than 5A max current can be considered for dual reference implementation. (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleave requirementRefer to topology section for details.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 max via stub length< 900 um
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
Routing in DSL configurationIf DSL configuration is used (for ex: PCIE1-3 is in layer 4 and there are signals routed in L3, this is assumed to be DSL configuration). Avoid power or ground planes in layer 3 above PCIE1-3 signals. Prefer low speed/GPIO signals in layer 3 above PCIE1-3 signals.
Parallel routing in DSL configurationIf signals are routed in same direction (less than 30 degrees between routing in layers 4 and layer 3), please refer to General Dual Stripline Routing Recommendations.
Cris-crossing signals in DSL configurationFor PCIE1-3 signals, recommended maximum number of cris-crossing signals is 15. If same signal cris-crossing twice, it is counted as 2 cris-crossings.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 Ohm resistor for PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe30402 or smaller size . Component pads reference plane needs to be voided.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for thin stackupIt is required to use 0201.
Voiding recommendation for thin stackupIt is required to void unused (non-functional) pads reference plane for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe Gen 1-3 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen1 Device Down Topology

PCIe Gen1 Device Down Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen1 Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
AC capacitor valueGen1: 75 nF - 265 nF Gen1 nominal = 100 nF
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed. The maximum total breakout length is still 15.2 mm.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx6Total ChannelGEN1 (not counting microvia under package)

Signal MRTS

M1Trace23
M2Trace34
AC CapCapacitor45
M3Trace56
TX, RXDevice6-1

PCIe Gen1 Internal Cable Topology

PCIe Gen1 Internal Cable Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen1 Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in-card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38 mm to 50.4 mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/ SL/ DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1.
AC capacitor valueGen1: 75 nF - 265 nF Gen1 nominal = 100 nF
Cable loss vs channel length trade-off tableSee PCIe with internal cable routing length versus cable loss figure.
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed. The total breakout length is still 15.2 mm.
Clarification on M2 segment for RXThe M2 segment for RX can also be routed on SL or DSL and not limited to MS.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Tx2Total ChannelGEN1 (not counting microvia under package).
Rx1Total ChannelGEN1 (not counting microvia under package).
Rx, Tx1Post-ChannelDaughter card/Add-in card

(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen3 CEM Topology

PCIe Gen3 CEM Topology Diagram
PCIE3 CEM Connector Antipad Optimization
PCIE3 CEM Connector Sideband Optimization
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Connector Voiding
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 1
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 2
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation_ Toe Side HSIO Routing
(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen3 CEM Topology Notes
NoteDetail
AC cap ValueGen3: 176 nF - 265 nF Gen3 nominal = 220 nF See AC capacitor general guidelines for M.2 SSD storage routing on SATA/ PCIe multiplexed ports figure.
CEM connector Vss pad to via distanceEach CEM connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5 mm (19 mils) max.
Add-in cardAssuming ~76 mm of PCB routing with spec reference package.
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed. The maximum total breakout length is still 15.2 mm.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Tx3Total ChannelGEN3 (not counting microvia under package).
Rx2Total ChannelGEN3 (not counting microvia under package).

PCIe Gen 4

Type-4 PCB Via Stitching Recommendation
Recommended GND Stitching Via Placement
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Toe and Heel GND Via Recommendation
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCIe Gen 4 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). IO power rails with less than 5A max current can be considered for dual reference implementation. (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads reference plane for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe4 AC capacitor size for mainstream stackupIt is required to use 0402. If routing near maximum length it is recommended to use 0201 component size.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleaved requirementRefer to topology section for details.
PCIe4 max via stub length< 250 um
Via stub length relaxationPTH via stub length can be relaxed, refer to "MTL-UH PCIe Gen4 Stub Length Requirement Relaxation White Paper" #723631 for details.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers. For PCIe4, see topology specific notes for additional guidance.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
Fiberweave for PCIe4Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
PCIe4 redriverRouting length can be extended beyond the PDG guidelines by using redriver. Refer to document #575423 for details.
Routing in DSL configurationIf DSL configuration is used (for ex: PCIE4 is in layer 4 and there are signals routed in L3, this is assumed to be DSL configuration). Avoid power or ground planes in layer 3 above PCIE4 signals. Prefer low speed/GPIO signals in layer 3 above PCIE4 signals.
Parallel routing in DSL configurationIf signals are routed in same direction (less than 30 degrees between routing in layers 4 and layer 3), please refer to General Dual Stripline Routing Recommendations.
Cris-crossing signals in DSL configurationFor PCIE4 signals, recommended maximum number of cris-crossing signals is 15. If same signal cris-crossing twice, it is counted as 2 cris-crossings.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 Ohm resistor for PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe30402 or smaller size . Component pads need to be voided.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for thin stackupIt is required to use 0201.
Voiding recommendation for thin stackupIt is required to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
PCIe Gen 4 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen4 Device Down Topology

PCIe Gen4 Device Down Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen4 Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Device / End Point package insertion lossDevice / End Point needs to be within the 3 dB specification as per the PCIe Base Spec Rev 4.0 Version 1.0.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx4Total Channel

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
RX, TXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
M3Trace45
AC CapCapacitor56
M4Trace67
TX, RXDevice7-1

Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), Rx,Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Standard Loss (SL)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

PCIe Gen4 Device Down Topology Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL12.7
M1+M2+M3MS, DSLMax length is BO+M1+M2+M3+M4 < 267 mm
M4MS12.7

Max Length Total (mm): 267

Max Length Total Note: Max length is BO+M1+M2+M3+M4 < 267 mm (Applies only to std loss stack-up and devices which support PCIe Gen4 max insertion loss). IF DSL, +0.25inch

PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology

PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen3 and Gen4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-Interleaved routes in different layers.
M.2 connector Vss pad to via distanceEach M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5 mm (19 mils) max.
Add-in cardAssuming ~50 mm of PCB routing and 2 vias with spec reference package. The total length matching RX-RX/TX-TX lane to lane (25mm max) include the budget within the module.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Notes
NoteDetail
Backdrilled viaAllow for exit backdrill via of 250 um with 180 um entry stub.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

M3Trace45

PCIe Gen4 M.2 MUX Topology

PCIE GEN4 M.2 MUX TOpology Diagram
PCIe Gen4 M.2 MUX Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen3 and Gen4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-Interleaved routes in different layers.
M.2 connector Vss pad to via distanceEach M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5mm (19 mils) max.
Add-in cardAssuming ~50 mm of PCB routing and 2 vias with spec reference package. The total length matching RX-RX/TX-TX lane to lane (25mm max) include the budget within the module.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Notes
NoteDetail
Backdrilled viaAllow for exit backdrill via of 250 um with 180 um entry stub.

Signal Group: Rx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
RXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
M3Trace45
MUXDevice56
M4Trace67
M.2 ConnectorDevice7-1

Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), Rx,Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Standard Loss (SL)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen4 CEM Topology

PCIe Gen4 CEM Topology Diagram
PCIE4 CEM Connector Antipad Optimization
PCIE4 CEM Connector Sideband Optimization
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Connector Voiding
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 1
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 2
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation_ Toe Side HSIO Routing
(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen4 CEM Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap ValueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-Interleaved routes in different layers.
M.2 connector Vss pad to via distanceEach CEM connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5mm (19 mils) max.
Add-in cardAssuming ~76 mm of PCB routing and 2 vias with spec reference package. The total length matching RX-RX/TX-TX lane to lane (25mm max) include the budget within the module.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Notes
NoteDetail
Backdrilled viaAllow for exit backdrill via of 250 um with 180 um entry stub.

Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), Rx,Tx

(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen4 CEM Topology Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL12.7
M1+M2MS, DSLMax length is BO+M1+M2+M3 < 140 mm
M3MS12.7

Max Length Total (mm): 140

Max Length Total Note: Max length is BO+M1+M2+M3 < 140 mm; IF DSL, +0.25inch

Type-C TBT+USB+DP

Type-C TBT+USB+DP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Optimal routingFor optimal performance it is recommended to begin layout with TBT routing, use arc routing and maintain 3H spacing to vias/ void/ splits. It's also recommended that return loss specification of routing from retimer to Type-C connector is met. It is listed in section 5.5.1.1. of Type-C specification (Document #557111).
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupRecommend 0201 components. It is OK to use 0402 component between CPU and retimer when NOT routing near maximum length. Strongly recommend 0201 components between retimer and Type-C connector, 0402 components may result in return loss spec violation.
Recommended short protection circuitIt is recommended to include this circuit to comply with USB ECN \"RX AC Coupling Capacitor Option\" to provide ESD/ EOS protection and set RX bias at the Type-C connector. See notes on each topology for Intel's recommendation on DC rating of the Crx. The customer should consider short event to VBUS that can be up to 50 V.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left unconnected at the BGA ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission lines should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
Routing in DSL configurationIf DSL configuration is used (for ex: Type-C is in layer 4 and there are signals routed in L3, this is assumed to be DSL configuration.) Avoid power or ground planes in layer 3 above Type-C signals. Prefer low speed/GPIO signals in layer 3 above Type-C signals.
Parallel routing in DSL configurationIf signals are routed in same direction (less than 30 degrees between routing in layer 4 and layer 3), maintain offset of at least 350 um. (refer to dual stripline routing recommendations for definition of offset)
Cris-crossing signals in DSL configurationFor Type-C signals, recommended maximum number of cris-crossing signals is 15. If same signal cris-crosses twice, it is counted as 2 cris-crossings.
Reference plane Microstrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
TCP0_dfx_dmonobs_n/p_lv[1:0]Do not include in external PDG. Route as 50 single ended impedance traces. Provide good noise isolation (12 mil minimum). Connect to SMA/ SMP.
TCP0_dfx_amon_obs_lvDo not include in external PDG. Route as 50 single ended impedance traces. Provide good noise isolation (12 mil minimum). Connect to SMA/ SMP.
Type-C TBT+USB+DP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.125
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Topology

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Topology Diagram
Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed2 before retimer, 2 after retimer.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
ESDOn-Semi ESDL2012 or ESDL2013. Alternative option: Semtech RClamp1011ZC.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. For the pre-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V.
Rb resistor value220 k 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value1 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerHayden Bridge
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to retimer pins17 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB3.2 Gen2x2, USB4.0 Gen3 and DP2.1 (HBR3 up to 8.1Gbps per lane).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
CIO Topology component placementESD Diode, AC cap/Crx cap, Rb resistor and Rc resistor should be placed as close as possible to USBC connector up to 10mm radius.
AC return current path capacitors10nF to 22nF including tolerance. For 20v VBUS: 25v DC rated; For 28v VBUS: 35v DC rated; For 35v VBUS: 50v DC rated; For 48v VBUS: 63v DC rated. Please prefer 0201 form factor if possible. Should be placed as close as possible to type-C VBUS and GND pads.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx2Pre-Channel
Rx, Tx2Post-Channel

M5Trace1518

M2Trace34

SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL8
M1+M2MS, DSL185

Min Length Total (mm): 60

Min Length Total Note: Min length should be atleast 120mm (M1+M2 = 120mm), if more than 90% is routed as Dual stripline.

(Internal RVP) Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Topology

Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Topology Diagram
(Internal RVP) Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed2 before retimer, 2 after retimer.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
ESDOn-Semi ESDL2012 or ESDL2013. Alternative option: Semtech RClamp1011ZC.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V. For the pre-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 k 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerHayden Bridge
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to retimer pins17 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB3.2 Gen2x2, USB4.0 Gen3 and DP2.1 (HBR3 up to 8.1Gbps per lane).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

(Internal RVP) Type-C TBT+USB+DP 40G Retimer with M.2 Modular Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed2 before retimer on main board, 2 after retimer on modular card.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
ESDOn-Semi ESDL2012 or ESDL2013. Alternative option: Semtech RClamp1011ZC.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V. For the pre-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 k 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerHayden Bridge
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to retimer pins16.5 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB3.2 Gen2x2, USB4.0 Gen3 and DP2.1 (HBR3 up to 8.1Gbps per lane).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
M.2 ConnectorEquivalent performance with M.2 Gen5 spec connector or better.

(Not POR) Type-C TBT+USB+DP 20G Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed2 before retimer, 2 after retimer.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
ESDOn-Semi ESDL2012 or ESDL2013. Alternative option: Semtech RClamp1011ZC.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V. For the pre-channel cap - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 k 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 5%.

Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

Category: Mainstream

Material: Standard Loss (SL)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Pre-Channel

(Not POR) Type-C TBT+USB+DP 20G Retimer Topology Mainstream, Standard Loss (SL), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL8
M1+M2MS, DSL302

Max Length Total (mm): 302

Type-C USB+DP

Type-C USB+DP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackup0402, if routing near maximum length it is recommended to use 0201 component size.
Recommended short protection circuitIt is recommended to include this circuit to comply with USB ECN \"RX AC Coupling Capacitor Option\" to provide ESD/ EOS protection and set RX bias at the Type-C connector. Intel's recommendation on DC rating of the Crx is 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/50 V (Extended Power Range implemented). The customer should consider short event to VBUS that can be up to 20 V.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs, AC cap and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left as no connect at the BGA ball.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Reference plane guidelinesMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
Type-C USB+DP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

(Internal RVP) Type-C USB+DP Main Link with M.2 Modular Topology

Type-C USB+DP Main Link with M.2 Modular Topology Diagram
(Internal RVP) Type-C USB+DP Main Link with M.2 Modular Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed4 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s)
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s)
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 k 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen 2x2 (10 Gbps per lane) and updated notes DP2.1 (HBR3 up to 8.1Gbps per lane)
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
M.2 ConnectorEquivalent performance with M.2 Gen5 spec connector or better.

(Internal RVP) Type-C USB+DP Redriver with M.2 Modular Topology

Type-C USB+DP Main Link with M.2 Modular Topology Diagram
(Internal RVP) Type-C USB+DP Redriver with M.2 Modular Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed4 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s)
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s)
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 k 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen 2x2 (10 Gbps per lane) and DP2.1 (HBR3 up to 8.1Gbps per lane)
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
M.2 ConnectorEquivalent performance with M.2 Gen5 spec connector or better.

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver USB+DP

Type-C USB+DP - Redrier topology
Redriver USB+DP Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed4 (route within 2 layers) before redriver, 2 after redriver
Maximum via stub length375um per via between SOC and redriver. Redriver post-channel cannot have via stub.
CMCFor CMC refer to EMC section. Populating will not reduce the supported length
ESDFor ESD refer to EMC section.
AC Cap Value75nF to 265nF including tolerance, 25V for cap closest to Type-C connector
Crx Cap Value297nF to 363nF including tolerance, 25V
Rb Resistor Value220k 5%, 25V
TX Bleed Resistor PlaceholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC Cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs
RedriverRedriver selection is open to customer choice, Intel does not recommend specific Redriver
Supported InterfacesUSB3.2 Gen2, and DP2.1 (HBR3 up to 8.1Gbps per lane)

Type-C USB+DP Main Link Internal Cable Topology

Type-C USB+DP Main Link Internal Cable Topology Diagram
Type-C USB+DP Main Link Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed4 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s).
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V(Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 k 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
203 mm cable assembly76-94 including tolerance. Insertion loss -2.5 dB @ 2.5 GHz, -3.3 dB @ 5.0 GHz. Crosstalk -33 dB @ 5-10 GHz.
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen 2x2 (10 Gbps per lane) and DP2.1 (HBR3 up to 8.1Gbps per lane)
Length trade-off for mainstream stackupIf 60 mm < BO+M[1:6] 85 mm then Mcable 127 mm.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

Type-C USB

Type-C USB General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackup0402, if routing near maximum length it is recommended to use 0201 component size.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs, AC cap and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left no connected at the BGA ball.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Reference planeMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
Type-C USB Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

Maximum via stub length375 um per via.

ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V.
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen1 (5 Gbps)
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

USB2.0

USB2.0 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Refer to USB 2.0 DCR ECN for D+ and D- maximum series DC resistance (DCR) specification.
Reference planeMicrostrip: Must be continuous ground Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Dual Stripline: Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a IO rail power plane with Iccmax < 5A that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.

Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch

2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

USB3.2

Description: This PHY only supports configuration with standard Type-A connector.

USB3.2 Stub Requirement
USB3.2 Component Routing Requirement
USB3.2 Component Pad Voiding Requirement
USB3.2 Receptacle Ground Void Dimension Recommendations
USB3.2 Signals to PTH Transition Requirement
USB3.2 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch < 0.254 mm. Total length mismatch < 0.127 mm.
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 381 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Tx AC cap value for USB3.2 Gen1 & Gen2AC capacitor value: 100 nF nominal (75 nF - 265 nF range).
Short circuit protection for Type-C topology (if applicable)Crx cap value: 297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V. Rb resistor value: 220 k 5%.
Component size requirement ( CMC, ESD, AC cap, Resistor)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um (2 mils) overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Cable and connector recommendationStrongly recommended to use SMT connectors. For PTH connectors (assuming connector is on the top), USB3.2 signals need to be routed from the bottom of the board such that there is no stub on for connector entry. Intel strongly recommends selecting cables and connectors which meet electrical requirements specified in both USB-IF Cable and Connector Specification dated June 2017 and Universal Serial Bus 3.1 Legacy Connectors and Cable Assemblies Compliance dated April 2018. The USB-IF does not certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen2 stacked connectors. The USB-IF does certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen1 stacked connectors. Refer USB-IF for more details.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential oval antipad required for all layers. Suggest using differential signal antipad with 2 mm size.
Repeater pad voidingA differential void on L2 that is larger than the repeater with 50.8 um (2 mils) overcut is recommended. GND referencing is needed on L3. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). IO power rails with less than 5A max current can be considered for dual reference implementation. (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Cris-crossing signals in DSL configurationFor USB32 signals, recommended maximum number of cris-crossing signals is 15. If same signal cris-crosses twice, it is counted as 2 cris-crossings.
USB3.2 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

Max Length Total (mm): 292.1

UFS

UFS General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 11mils for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Component size requirement ( CMC)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um (2 mils) overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). IO power rails with less than 5A max current can be considered for dual reference implementation. (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Routing in DSL configurationIf DSL configuration is used (for ex: UFS is in layer 4 and there are signals routed in L3, this is assumed to be DSL configuration). Avoid power or ground planes in layer 3 above UFS signals. Prefer low speed/GPIO signals in layer 3 above UFS signals.
Parallel routing in DSL configurationIf signals are routed in same direction (less than 30 degrees between routing in layers 4 and layer 3), please refer to General Dual Stripline Routing Recommendations.
Cris-crossing signals in DSL configurationFor UFS signals, recommended maximum number of cris-crossing signals is 15. If same signal cris-crossing twice, it is counted as 2 cris-crossings.
UFS Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes12.7
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes12.7
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

UFS Gear 4 Device Down Topology

UFS Gear 4 Device Down Topology Diagram
UFS Gear 4 Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Common mode chokeOptional. However, if the surface routing near the connector exceeds 25mm, a CMC is required. For more information, refer to the EMC section.
Reference planeContinuous ground recommended.
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed.
Minimum length Minimum length of 63.5 mm.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx2Total Channel
Rx, Tx1Additional via transitions between top and bottom layers are allowed to facilitate device access.

M2Trace34

M3Trace56
RxDevice6-1

CATERR#

NoteDetail
Rpu2.2 k 20%. Total length can be extended up to 1524 mm. Refer to "CATERR# Topology Routing Length vs Rpu Guideline Table" for details.
Signal name/ listCATERR#
