152451.5 k 10%

CLINK

CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum trace DC resistance 13
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listCL_CLK, CL_DATA, CL_RST#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx5Total Channel
Tx5Total Channel

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
CONNECTORDevice3-1

Segment Lengths

CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL12.7
M1MS, DSL241.3
M2MS, DSL38.1

Max Length Total (mm): 292.1

CNVi BRI and RGI

CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Topology

CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load M.2 Connector Topology Diagram
CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Module Down Topology Diagram
CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Max frequency40 MHz
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended for microstrip line. (2) Dual continuous GND is recommended for strip line. (3) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (4) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
R1[1] 24 5% for max total length 76.2 mm. [2] 30 5% for max total length < 76.2 mm. To be placed 12.7 mm (can be extended to 25.4 mm) from the CPU for CNV_BRI_DT and CNV_RGI_DT signal.
R2[1] 30 5% for max total length 76.2 mm [2] 36 5% for max total length < 76.2 mm To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector for CNV_BRI_RSP and CNV_RGI_RSP signal.
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Signal name/ listCNV_BRI_DT, CNV_RGI_DT, CNV_BRI_RSP, CNV_RGI_RSP.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx4Total Channel
Tx4Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
R1Resistor34
M2Trace45
DeviceDevice5-1

Signal Group: Rx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
M5Trace12
M4Trace23
R2Resistor34
M3Trace45
DeviceDevice5-1

CPU GPIO

CPU GPIO CMOS Buffer Type Topology

CPU GPIO 1-Load Topology Diagram
CPU GPIO Multi-Load Branch Topology Diagram
Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation
Example of Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation
CPU GPIO CMOS Buffer Type Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Total trace lengthTotal trace length options as below: [1] Total trace length BO + M1 + BI =< 177.8 mm, or [2] Total trace length BO + M2 + BI =< 177.8 mm, or [3] Total trace length BO + Mn + BI =< 177.8 mm.
Strapping resistor, R_strap20 k on need basis, for strapping purposes. Resistor can be either pull-up or pull-down depending on strapping design.
Number of vias allowedNo restriction.
Reference planeNo restriction.
Note 1R_strap resistor is optional depending on signal needs and can be anywhere along M1, M2, Mn lane. Refer to EDS or device datasheet for the requirement.
Note 2Main route of Mn can start anywhere along M1 as long as the total length of each branch from CPU to device is less than 177.8 mm.
Note 3R_strap resistor value depends on power sequence/ strapping's timing and DC voltage level requirement (refer below for calculation details).
Note 4Level shifter may be needed depending on actual device implementation. Generally no length restriction after level shifter.
Note 5For CPU input-only signal, if device output is open drain buffer type, then proper pull-up resistor, Rpu is needed and refer to "Rise Time and R_strap or Rpu Calculation" section for details.
Note 6Noise sensitive GPIO pin should be properly shielded/ with sufficient trace spacing (e.g.: 3x of trace width). This is to prevent undesirable random system reset. Examples of signal: PMU_PLTRST_B, FORCEPR#.
Rise time and R_strap or Rpu calculation
R_strap or Rpu formulaRefer image [Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor].
Bus capacitance rule of thumb, CbDevice = 10 pF per device. Board trace = 3.3 pF per 25.4 mm of trace length.
Example[1] Total bus length = 10 inches --> 10 x 3.3 pF = 33 pF. [2] Branch topology with two devices --> 2 x 10 pF = 20 pF. [3] With a rise time requirement (tr) = 1 us. Refer image [Example for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation].

Segment Lengths

CPU GPIO CMOS Buffer Type Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL12.7
M1MS, DSL177.6
BIMS, DSL12.7

Max Length Total (mm): 203

[For Internal Reference] GPIO Open Drain Buffer Type Topology

Description: Note: For internal reference only! Do not publish in external PDG!

Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation
Example for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation
[For Internal Reference] GPIO Open Drain Buffer Type Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Note 1No length/ topology restriction.
Note 2Pull-up resistor, Rpu can be calculated based on rise time requirement (refer to "Rise time and R_strap or Rpu calculation" section for details). Rise time requirement may varies depending on device requirement (if any), refer to device data sheet.
Note 3Intel input buffer does not have any rise/ fall time requirement. For device TX open drain signal, refer to device's design guide or Intel reference schematic for pull-up resistor value.
Rise time and R_strap or Rpu calculation
R_strap or Rpu formulaRefer image [Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor].
Bus capacitance rule of thumb, CbDevice = 10 pF per device. Board trace = 3.3 pF per 25.4 mm of trace length.
Example[1] Total bus length = 10 inches --> 10 x 3.3 pF = 33 pF. [2] Branch topology with two devices --> 2 x 10 pF = 20 pF. [3] With a rise time requirement (tr) = 1 us. Refer image [Example for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation].

DMIC

DMIC 2-Load Branch Topology

DMIC 2-Load Branch CLK Topology Diagram
DMIC 2-Load Branch DATA Topology Diagram
DMIC 2-Load Branch Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R1 & C1[1] EMI RC filter placeholder: Stuff R1 with 0 and unstuff C1 by default. Refer to EMC section for details. [2] To be placed only for DMIC_CLK. [3] C1 is recommended to be placed close to R1. C1 is recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the CPU, but can be extended to 25.4 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum. If M1 is routed on MS, EMI RC filter should be placed at the beginning of the MS routing.
R250 . [1] R2 is recommended to be placed immediate after the branches. [2] If the branches not immediately split after connector, please follow rule [1].
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between branchBranch 1 and branch 2 need to be length matched within 2.54 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signalsN/A
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D: 40 . [2] GPP_S: 50 , slew 11.
Signal name/ listDMIC_CLK_A[0:1], DMIC_DATA[0:1].
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
R1Resistor24
M1Trace35
C1Capacitor46
CONNECTORDevice5-1
GNDGround6-1

Signal Group: Rx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
CONNECTORDevice3-1

DMIC 2-Load Daisy Topology

DMIC 2-Load Daisy CLK Topology Diagram

DMIC 2-Load Daisy Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R1 & C1[1] EMI RC filter placeholder: Stuff R1 with 0 and unstuff C1 by default. Refer to EMC section for details. [2] To be placed only for DMIC_CLK. [3] C1 is recommended to be placed close to R1. C1 is recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the CPU, but can be extended to 25.4 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum. If M1 is routed on MS, EMI RC filter should be placed at the beginning of the MS routing.
R250 . R2 is recommended to be placed immediate after the branches from connector.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).

Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm

NoteDetail

[For Internal Validation] eSPI 2-Load Branch (Device Down) Topology

eSPI 2-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
[For Internal Validation] eSPI 2-Load Branch (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyDevice 1: EC at 50 MHz. Device 2: SIO/ TPM at 33 MHz.
Device assumptionCompliant to Intel ESPI base specification 1.0 (66 MHz and above).
R10 for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
R218 5% for ESPI_CLK and 0 placeholder for ESPI_IO[0:3].
R318 5% for ESPI_CLK and 0 placeholder for ESPI_IO[0:3].
M5 segmentIt is recommended to have MS routing.
Minimum length, total50.8 mm
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listESPI_CLK, ESPI_IO[0:3], ESPI_CS[0:1]#, ESPI_ALERT[0:1]#, ESPI_RESET#.
DATA routing requirements (For 50MHz at 190.5mm maximum length)DATA must be routed in between DATA & Pseudo Static Signals, by following this approach, TS can be 125um. Min. Length for MS/DSL routing need to meet 50.8mm.
CLK routing requirements (For 50MHz at 190.5mm maximum length)CLK can be routed in between DATA & Pseudo Static Signals, by following this approach, TS can be 375um. Min. Length for MS/DSL routing need to meet 50.8mm.
Topology maximum lengthThis topology approach was designed to meet route length of the eSPI for 50MHz path at 190.5mm and 33MHz path at 215.9mm that was requested and agreed between SI and RVP Team
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx6Total Channel
Tx6Total Channel
Rx6Total Channel

Signal MRTS

R10 for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].

M5 segmentIt is recommended to have MS routing.
Minimum length, total50.8 mm

Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listESPI_CLK, ESPI_IO[0:3], ESPI_CS[0:1]#, ESPI_ALERT[0:1]#, ESPI_RESET#.
Topology maximum lengthThis topology approach was designed to meet route length of the eSPI for 50MHz path at 190.5mm and 33MHz path at 215.9mm that was requested and agreed between SI and RVP Team
DATA routing requirements (For 50MHz at 190.5mm maximum length)DATA must be routed in between DATA & Pseudo Static Signals, by following this approach, TS can be 125um. Min. Length for MS/DSL routing need to meet 50.8mm.
CLK routing requirements (For 50MHz at 190.5mm maximum length)CLK can be routed in between DATA & Pseudo Static Signals, by following this approach, TS can be 375um. Min. Length for MS/DSL routing need to meet 50.8mm.

GSPI

GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency25 MHz
R115 5%. To be placed on GSPI[0:1]_MOSI, GSPI0A_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]_MISO, and GSPI0A_MISO
M2 length extensionCan support up to 190.5mm but the bus frequency needs to reduce to 20MHz.
Minimum lengthBO + M1 + M2: 38.1 mm.
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 9 ns. Data input hold time < 5 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 14 ns.
Device driver strength characteristics Impedance: 50 to 100 . 0.85 ns < rise/ fall time measured at 20%-80% < 1.9 ns based on 10 pF test load. 1.6 pF input capacitance, Cin 1.75 pF.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength50 .
Signal name/ listGSPI[0:1]_CLK, GSPI[0:1]_MISO, GSPI[0:1]_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]_CS0#, GSPI0A_CLK, GSPI0A_MOSI, GSPI0A_MISO, GSPI0A_CS0#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
R1Resistor34
M2Trace45
CONNECTORCable5-1

Segment Lengths

GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL12.7
M1MS, DSL12.7
M2MS, DSL88.9Can extend up to 190.5mm with maximum 20MHz bus frequency.

Max Length Total (mm): 114.3

Max Length Total Note: Total length can extend to 215.9mm with maximum 20MHz bus frequency.

GSPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology

GSPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology Diagram
GSPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency12 MHz
R110 5%. To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector on GSPI[0:1]_CLK, GSPI[0:1]_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]_MISO, GSPI0A_CLK, GSPI0A_MOSI, GSPI0A_MISO.
M_cableRecommended to use shielded cable.
Minimum lengthM1: 25.4 mm. M2: 2.54 mm. M_cable: 25.4 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength40 .
Signal name/ listGSPI[0:1]_CLK, GSPI[0:1]_MISO, GSPI[0:1]_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]_CS0#, GSPI0A_CLK, GSPI0A_MOSI, GSPI0A_MISO, GSPI0A_CS0#.

HDA

HDA 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

HDA 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
HDA 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R120 5%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the CPU.
R233 10%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from device.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Dual stripline (DSL)No parallelism between CLK and DATA signals, as well as DATA and DATA signals.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength40 .
Signal name/ listHDA_SDO, HDA_SDI0, HDA_BCLK, HDA_SYNC, HDA_RST#.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

NoteDetail
R120 5%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 38.1 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R233 10%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from device.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Dual stripline (DSL)No parallelism between CLK and DATA signals, as well as DATA and DATA signals.

M_CableCable203.2

Max Length Total (mm): 551.3

Max Length Total Note: 1) Total max length to ALC274 AIC = 551.3 mm; 2) Total max length to Gen3 AIC = 868.8 mm; 3) Total max length to Gen4 AIC = 691 mm.

ISH-SPI

ISH-SPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

ISH-SPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
ISH-SPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency25 MHz
R1[1] 0 (placeholder). To be placed on ISH_SPI_CLK, ISH_SPI_MOSI.
Minimum length56 mm
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 5 ns. Data input hold time < 5 ns. 1 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 15 ns.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength50 .
Signal name/ listISH_SPI_CLK, ISH_SPI_MISO, ISH_SPI_MOSI, ISH_SPI_CS#, ISH_SPIA_CLK, ISH_SPIA_MISO, ISH_SPIA_MOSI, ISH_SPIA_CS#.
DATA routing requirementsMISO signal routed in between MOSI & CS# with Trace Spacing=125um
CLK routing requirementCLK signal routed in between CS# and other DATA signal with Trace Spacing=375um.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
R1Resistor34
M2Trace45
CONNECTORDevice56
DEVICEDevice6-1

Segment Lengths

ISH-SPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL12.7
M1MS, DSL25.4
M2MS, DSL215.9

Max Length Total (mm): 254

I2C

I2C General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Note 1Multiple options for pull-up/ pull-down and current assist strengths are provided for a particular total bus capacitance. Choose the optimal value for system based on design considerations like power, BOM and cost.
Note 2Trace capacitance per inch is approximately CL = 85r / Zo pF, r - dielectric constant of material, Zo - trace impedance.
Note 3Bus capacitance calculation assumptions: [1] Device capacitance = 5 pF to 10 pF per I2C device. [2] Motherboard board trace capacitance = 2 pF to 5 pF per inch of trace length. [3] CPU pin capacitance = 8 pF to 10 pF.

I2C Topology

I2C Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 to 70 .
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between SCL and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between SDA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (SDA, SCL)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "830097_WCL_I2C_SMBUS_SMLINK_EIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Signal name/ listI2C[0:5]_SDA, I2C[0:5]_SCL, a_I2C[2:5]_SDA, a_I2C[2:5]_SCL, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SDA, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SCL, a_ISH_I2C2_SDA, a_ISH_I2C2_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SDA

I2C Standard Mode (100 kHz)

Frequency: 100 kHz

Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF8.2 k100
Up to 100 pF4.7 k100
Up to 200 pF2.2 k100
Up to 300 pF1.5 k100
Up to 400 pF1.2 k100

Up to 100 pF1.5 k100
70 pF to 200 pF820 100
70 pF to 400 pF620 100

I2C for DDR5 SPD Topology

I2C for DDR5 SPD Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 to 70 .
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between SCL and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between SDA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (SDA, SCL)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Max stub length to device127 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "830097_WCL_I2C_SMBUS_SMLINK_EIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Max SPD device input capacitance5 pF
General recommendations for DDR5 SPD[1] It is recommended to have a dedicated bus for DDR5 SPD usage. [2] If dedicated bus is not possible, it is recommended to use a voltage translator to shift the signal down to 1V to match the SPD device.
Signal name/ listI2C[0:5]_SDA, I2C[0:5]_SCL, a_I2C[2:5]_SDA, a_I2C[2:5]_SCL, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SDA, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SCL, a_ISH_I2C2_SDA, a_ISH_I2C2_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SDA

I2C Standard Mode (100 kHz)

Frequency: 100 kHz

I2C Standard Mode (100 kHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF8.2 k100
Up to 100 pF4.7 k100
Up to 200 pF2.7 k100
Up to 300 pF1.8 k100
Up to 400 pF1.5 k50

I2S

I2S General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Host/ device mode terminologyHost Mode refers to the mode where the clock is driven by Intel CPU. Device Mode refers to the mode where the clock is driven by external device.

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R10 placeholder. Recommended to be placed 25.4 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R222 . Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from device.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Minimum length, totalBO + M1 + M2: 50.8 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 . [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 , slew 11.
Signal name/ listI2S[0:2]_SCLK, I2S[0:2]_SFRM, I2S[0:2]_TXD, I2S[0:2]_RXD.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
I2S Signal Ganging with CNVi GPIO Topology Diagram
I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R10 placeholder. Recommended to be placed 25.4 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R222 . Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from connector/ header.
R3 (applicable to I2S to discrete CNV module topology only)1k . Used for ganging I2S signals with CNVi GPIO signals. Required on the CNVi GPIO signals, to be placed <2" from the ganging point.
Additional guidelines for I2S to discrete CNV module topology[1] For I2S topology connecting to discrete connectivity module, there is a requirement to share/ gang I2S signals with CNVi GPIO signals (RF_RESET_B and CLKREQ) onto the same physical line: - I2S_SFRM with RF_RESET_B - I2S_TXD with CLKREQ [2] A 1k resistor (R3) is required on the CNVi GPIO signals, to be placed <2" from the ganging point. [3] Location of the ganging is not restricted and can be implemented anywhere along the bus. [4] Refer to "I2S signal ganging with CNVi GPIO" diagram for guidance on the implementation. Note that the I2S series resistors (R1 and R2) are still needed and considered in a separate topology diagram.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Minimum length, totalBO + M1 + M2: 50.8 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 . [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 , slew 11.
Signal name/ listI2S[0:2]_SCLK, I2S[0:2]_SFRM, I2S[0:2]_TXD, I2S[0:2]_RXD.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx7Total Channel
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

M2MS, DSL177.8
M3MS, DSL12.7

Max Length Total (mm): 203.2

I2S Device Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

I2S Device Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
I2S Device Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R10 placeholder. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R222 . Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from connector/ header.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Minimum length, totalBO + M1 + M2: 50.8 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 . [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 , slew 11.
Signal name/ listI2S[0:2]_SCLK, I2S[0:2]_SFRM, I2S[0:2]_TXD, I2S[0:2]_RXD.

I3C

I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology

I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Mixed bus topologyThis topology supports usages with a mix of I2C and I3C devices. For mixed I2C and I3C bus, routing should follow I3C PDG.
Reduced max lengthActual max length for I3C can go up to 1016 mm. Reduced max length is due to legacy I2C Fast Mode Plus (FM+) requirement.
Island terminology'Island refers to 1 to 3 devices connected and placed near to each other, where the max capacitance per island is 20 pF. For multiple devices within an island, the max stub length to each device is 25.4 mm.
Max frequency2 MHz
Rpu1 k.
R133 5% Placed within 25.4 mm distance from CPU.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength40 .
Max device buffer driver strength90
Signal name/ listI3C[0:2]_SDA, I3C[0:2]_SCL, I3C1A_SDA, I3C1A_SCL, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SDA, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SCL.

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
R1Resistor24
RpuResistor45
1p8VRail5-1
M1Trace36
IslandDevice6-1

I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology

I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Mixed bus topologyThis topology supports usages with a mix of I2C and I3C devices. For mixed I2C and I3C bus, the routing needs to follow the I3C PDG.
Reduced max lengthActual max length for I3C can go up to 762 mm. Reduced max length is due to legacy I2C Fast Mode Plus (FM+) requirement.
Island terminology'Island refers to 1 to 3 devices connected and placed near to each other, where the max capacitance per island is 20 pF. For multiple devices within an island, the max stub length to each device is 25.4 mm.
Max frequency2 MHz
Rpu1 k.
R133 5%. Placed within 25.4 mm distance from CPU.
R220 . Placed within 25.4 mm distance to device.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Max device buffer driver strength90

NoteDetail
R-1, R-2, R-n75 R-n + Dev-n drive strength 200 . [1] Drive strength of each device should be controlled within 75 to 200 , use an additional resistor if the device drive strength is too strong. [2] Optionally, if the device drive strength is 75 (weak), R-n is not needed. [3] Recommended to be placed < 127 mm from respective device.

RTC

RTC (Real Time Clock) Topology

32.768 kHz RTC Crystal Topology Diagram
RTC (Real Time Clock) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Length matching between RTC_X1 and RTC_X2Total length mismatch: 1.27 mm
GND shieldingGND shielding to adjacent signals (especially high speed IO) is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND only; do not reference to power planes. If routed as stripline or dual stripline, both top and bottom reference/ adjacent planes MUST be solid continuous ground.
External capacitor valuesExternal capacitors C1 and C2 must be matched (C1 = C2). Capacitor values should be tuned accordingly with respect to load capacitance for RTC crystal If the crystal load capacitance reduces (per component datasheet information), then C1/C2 should be reduced accordingly as well. For example, if the Cload is close to 10pF, then a more optimized C1/C2 value would be closer to 8pF (instead of 13pF) Due to vendor variation in crystal characteristic, layout variation and PCB trace, calculation is recommended to determine the C1/C2 value.
Main route (MR)Main route (MR) is recommended to be limited to SL/ DSL to limit coupling and impact from EMI/ RFI sources.
Rs resistorsResistors Rs1 and Rs2 are used as EMI/ RFI CMC placeholder (which can be stuffed as 0 Ohm placeholders). They can be omitted if the platform has no EMI/ RFI issue.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Tx2Total Channelrecommended to minimize number of vias

Segment Lengths

RTC (Real Time Clock) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL12.7
MRDSL

Max Length Total (mm): 20.3

Max Length Total Note: Max length of 20.3 mm is based on 0402 resistor and capacitor sizes assumption. Max length can be 25.4 mm if component sizes are reduced from 0402 to 0201.

SMBus 2.0/SMLink

SMBus 2.0/SMLink General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Note 1Multiple options for pull-up/ pull-down and current assist strengths are provided for a particular total bus capacitance. Choose the optimal value for system based on design considerations like power, BOM and cost.
Note 2Trace capacitance per inch is approximately CL = 85r / Zo pF, r - dielectric constant of material, Zo - trace impedance.
Note 3Bus capacitance calculation assumptions: [1] Device capacitance = 5 pF to 10 pF per SMBus 2.0/ SMLink device. [2] Motherboard board trace capacitance = 2 pF to 5 pF per inch of trace length. [3] CPU pin capacitance = 8 pF to 10 pF.

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink Topology

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 to 70 .
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between CLK and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between DATA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (DATA, CLK)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between DATA and CLK signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "830097_WCL_I2C_SMBUS_SMLINK_EIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Signal name/ listSMBCLK, SMBDATA, SMBALERT#, SML[0:1]CLK, SML[0:1]DATA, SML[0:1]ALERT#, USB-C_SMLCLK, USB-C_SMLDATA, SML0BCLK, SML0BDATA, SML0BALERT#, PSE_SMLCLK, PSE_SMLDATA, PSE_SMLALERT#

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink Standard Mode (100 kHz)

Frequency: 100 kHz

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink Standard Mode (100 kHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF5.6 k100
Up to 100 pF2.7 k100
Up to 200 pF1.5 k100
Up to 300 pF1 k100

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink for DDR5 SPD Topology

SMBus 2.0/ SMLink for DDR5 SPD Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 to 70 .
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between CLK and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between DATA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (DATA, CLK)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between DATA and CLK signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Max stub length to device127 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "830097_WCL_I2C_SMBUS_SMLINK_EIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Max SPD device input capacitance5 pF
General recommendations for DDR5 SPD[1] It is recommended to have a dedicated bus for DDR5 SPD usage. [2] If dedicated bus is not possible, it is recommended to use a voltage translator to shift the signal down to 1V to match the SPD device.
Signal name/ listSMBCLK, SMBDATA, SMBALERT#, SML[0:1]CLK, SML[0:1]DATA, SML[0:1]ALERT#, USB-C_SMLCLK, USB-C_SMLDATA, SML0BCLK, SML0BDATA, SML0BALERT#, PSE_SMLCLK, PSE_SMLDATA, PSE_SMLALERT#

SoundWire

SoundWire Large System: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
SoundWire Large System: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable characteristic impedance target50 10%.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency12.288 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedSingle-lane: Port #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3. Multi-lane: Port #2 (up to 3 data lane), Port #3 (up to 4 data lane).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 600 mm: [1] CLDS = 4 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 7 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 9 Clock Period For total length 600 mm: [1] CLDS = 6 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 7 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 9 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#: 609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 , slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 30% 2) Device series resistor of 56 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.
Signal name/ listSingle-lane: SNDW[0:3]_CLK, SNDW[0:3]_DATA0. Multi-lane: SNDW[2:3]_CLK, SNDW2_DATA[0:2], SNDW3_DATA[0:3], SNDW2A_DATA1.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx4Total Channel

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
TXDevice01

M1Trace23

Max Length Total (mm): 812.7

SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Star Topology

SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Star Topology Diagram
SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Star Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable_1/ M_Cable_2 characteristic impedance target50 10%.
R10 placeholder. To be placed 10 mm to 15 mm from the branch.
R20 placeholder. To be placed 5 mm to 10 mm after the branch.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max length, totalThis refers to the length from CPU to the end device of each branch. Option1: [1] B0 + M1 + M2_1 + M3_1 + M_Cable1; or [2] B0 + M1 + M2_2 + M3_2 + M_Cable2. Option2: [1] B0 + M1 + M2_1 + M3_1 + M4_1; or [2] B0 + M1 + M2_2 + M3_2 + M4_2.
Length matching between branch (Option1: M_cable1 & M_Cable2 or Option2: M4_1 & M5_2)10 mm
Max frequency9.6 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedPort #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 850. 9 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period For total length 850.9 mm: [1] CLDS = 9 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#: 609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 , slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 30% 2) Device series resistor of 56 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.
Signal name/ listSNDW[0:3]_CLK, SNDW[0:3]_DATA0.

SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (Device Down) Topology

SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (Device Down) Topology Diagram
SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable_1/ M_Cable_2 characteristic impedance target50 10%.
R10 placeholder. To be placed 10 mm to 15 mm from the first branch from CPU.
R20 placeholder. To be placed 5 mm to 10 mm from the device.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max length, totalThis refers to the length from CPU to the end device of each branch. [1] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_1 + M4_1_1 + M5_1_1; or [2] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_1 + M4_1_2 + M5_1_2; or [3] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_2 + M4_2_1 + M5_2_1; or [4] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_2 + M4_2_2 + M5_2_2.
Length matching between branch (M3_1 & M3_2)10 mm
Max frequency9.6 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedPort #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 571.5 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period For total length 571.5 mm: [1] CLDS = 9 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#: 609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 , slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 30% 2) Device series resistor of 91 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.

SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Dumbbell Topology

SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Dumbbell Topology
SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Dumbbell Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable_[1:2] characteristic impedance target50 10%.
R1Option 1: 10 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching. Option 2: 22 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching.
R2Option 1: 10 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching. Option 2: 22 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency9.6 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedPort #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 1003.3 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period For total length 1003.3 mm: [1] CLDS = 9 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#: 609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 , slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 30% 2) Device series resistor of 68 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.

SoundWire Large System: 3 to 4-Load Dumbbell Topology

SoundWire Large System: 3 to 4-Load Dumbbell Topology Diagram
SoundWire Large System: 3 to 4-Load Dumbbell Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable_[1:2] characteristic impedance target50 10%.
R115 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching.
R215 10%. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and 10 mm from the branching.
Multiload supportThis topology supports up to 4 devices. For 3-Load topology, only device 2/ 3/ 4 can be removed.
Length ExtensionTotal length for 3-Load topology can be extended up to 520 mm by increase segment length: [1] M4 + M_cable1 = 300 mm [2] M5 = 300 mm
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency9.6 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedPort #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 508 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period For total length 508 mm: [1] CLDS = 9 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#: 609917)

NoteDetail
M_Cable_[1:4] characteristic impedance target50 10%.
R10 placeholder. To be placed on SNDW_CLK only, and maximum 10 mm from the connector.
Multiload supportThis topology supports up to 4 devices where device placements are interchangable.
M_Cable_1 maximum length250 mm
Max allowable cable length between nearest device and furthest device from CPU300 mm
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).

SoundWire Small System: 1 to 4-Load Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology

SoundWire Small System: 1 to 4-Load Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Diagram
SoundWire Small System: 1 to 4-Load Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Multiload supportThis topology supports up to 4 devices where device placements are interchangable.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency12.288 MHz
SoundWire ports supported1 to 4-Load topology: Single-lane: Port #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3. 1-Load topology: Multi-lane: Port #2 (up to 3 data lane), Port #3 (up to 4 data lane).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configuration[1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#: 609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 , slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 30% 2) Device series resistor of 56 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.

[Internal Validation]SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (AIC) Topology

SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (AIC) Topology
[Internal Validation]SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (AIC) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable_1/ M_Cable_2 characteristic impedance target50 10%.
R10 placeholder. To be placed 10 mm to 15 mm from the first branch from CPU.
R20 placeholder. To be placed 5 mm to 10 mm from the device.
Number of vias allowed4
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max length, totalThis refers to the length from CPU to the end device of each branch. [1] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_1 + M_Cable_1 + M4_1_1 + M5_1_1; or [2] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_1 + M_Cable_1 + M4_1_2 + M5_1_2; or [3] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_2 + M_Cable_2 + M4_2_1 + M5_2_1; or [4] B0 + M1 + M2 + M3_2 + M_Cable_2 + M4_2_2 + M5_2_2.
Length matching between branch (M3_1 & M3_2)10 mm
Max frequency9.6 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedPort #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 571.5 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period For total length 571.5 mm: [1] CLDS = 9 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 10 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 10 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#: 609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 , slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 30% 2) Device series resistor of 91 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.
Signal name/ listSNDW[0:3]_CLK, SNDW[0:3]_DATA.

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameInstanceCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
R1Resistor34
M2Trace45
M2Trace46
M3_11Trace57
M3_12Trace68
CONN1Device7-1
CONN2Device8-1

Segment Lengths

[Internal Validation]SoundWire Large System: 4-Load Star (AIC) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL12.7
M1MS, DSL80
M2MS, DSL10
M_Cable_3MS, DSL10
M4_1_1/M4_1_2/M4_2_1/M4_2_2MS, DSL20
M5_1_1/M5_1_2/M5_2_1/M5_2_2MS, DSL10
M_Cable_1/M_Cable_2Cable370

Min Length Total (mm): 127

Max Length Total (mm): 512.7

Max Length Total Note: 1) Max length between CPU to the furthest end device = 512.7 mm; 2) Total topology length = 982.7 mm.

[For Internal Validation] Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines

Description: In the topology section the device buffer strength target recommendations are different depending on the Topology and its configuration. If devices used do not have buffer strengths that match the target recommendations and do not have the ability to adjust the buffer strengths through software you can adjust the impedance via an external resistor (R1) in series near the device, between the device and processor. To determine R1 the formula is: R1=Device Buffer Impedance Target - Actual Device Buffer Impedance.

[For Internal Validation] SoundWire* Device Drive Impedance Adjustment Diagram
[For Internal Validation] Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines Notes
NoteDetail
M110 mm
R1R1 = Device Drive Impedance Target - Device Buffer Strength. For example: Device Drive Impedance Target = 80 . Device Buffer Strength = 45 . Then R1 = 80 - 45 = 35 .

SPI0 Flash

SPI0 Flash 76.8MHz and 100MHz 1 to 3-Load Branch (Device Down) MAF Topology

SPI0 Flash 100MHz and 76.8MHz 1 Load Branch (Device Down) MAF Topology Diagram
SPI0 Flash 100MHz and 76.8MHz 2 Load Branch (Device Down) MAF with Flash and TPM Topology Diagram
SPI0 Flash 100MHz and 76.8MHz 2 Load Branch (Device Down) MAF with Flash and Debug Tool Topology Diagram
SPI0 Flash 100MHz and 76.8MHz 3 Load Branch (Device Down) MAF Topology Diagram
SPI0 Flash 76.8MHz and 100MHz 1 to 3-Load Branch (Device Down) MAF Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyFlash 1: 100 MHz. TPM and Debug Tool: < 14.3 MHz.
Flash ProgrammerRequire additional isolation circuitry to protect CPU from back-feed voltage when connect to flash programmer.
R120 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from flash device on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R2430 5%. To be placed within 5.08 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
Length from CPU to Flash 1Length from CPU to flash 1: = BO + M1 + M2 + M3
Minimum length, totalBO + M1 + M2 + M3 = 30.48 mm
Routing schemeInterleave 1 CS with every 2 DATA lanes is recommended. Recommend to route DATA and CLK on same layer.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 100MHz and 76.8MHz support[1] Driver strength spec: 50 or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% 2 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time 1.75 ns. [6] Data input hold time 2 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listSPI0_CLK, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_IO2, SPI0_IO3, SPI0_CS0# (for flash), SPI0_CS2# (for TPM)
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyFlash 1: 100 MHz. TPM and Debug Tool: < 14.3 MHz. EC: 50MHz.
R1 (100 MHz)5 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from flash device on SPI0_CLK. 10 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from flash device on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R1 (76.8 MHz)10 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from flash device on SPI0_CLK. 15 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from flash device on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.

Routing schemeInterleave 1 CS with every 2 DATA lanes is recommended. Recommend to route DATA and CLK on same layer.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 100MHz support[1] Driver strength spec: 45 or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% 2 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time 1.75 ns. [6] Data input hold time 2 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 76.8MHz support[1] Driver strength spec: 50 or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% 2 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time 1.75 ns. [6] Data input hold time 2 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
FET component criteriaRon < 4.5 . Cin < 6 pF.

SPI0 Flash 50MHz 1 to 4-Load Branch (Device Down) MAF Topology

SPI0 50MHz 1-Load MAF (Device Down) Topology Diagram

SPI0 Flash 50MHz 1 to 4-Load Branch (Device Down) MAF Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyFlash 1 & Flash 2: 50 MHz. TPM: 33 MHz.
Flash ProgrammerRequire additional isolation circuitry to protect CPU from back-feed voltage when connect to flash programmer.
R1 (For 1-Load MAF Topology)30 5%. To be placed within 5.08 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R1 (For 2-Load, 3-Load and 4-Load MAF Topology)30 5%. To be placed within 5.08 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK. 18 5%. To be placed within 5.08 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R251 5%. To be placed within 5.08 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R318 5%. To be placed within 5.08 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
Length from CPU to flash 1 or flash 2Length from CPU to flash 1 or flash 2: = BO + M1 + M2 + M3
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% 1.45 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Minimum length, totalMin length between CPU to the closest end device = 30.48 mm.
Stuffing resistorIf one of devices is unstuffed (rework), treat it as 4-Load topology thus place stuffing resistor as close as possible to the branch to avoid long stub length.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listSPI0_CLK, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_IO2, SPI0_IO3, SPI0_CS0# (for flash1), SPI0_CS1# (for flash2), SPI0_CS2# (for TPM)

R2[1] DATA: 10 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 0 placeholder. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
R3[1] DATA: 10 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 51 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.

[2] 0.4 ns rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 or stronger across worse case corners. [5] Data input setup time 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. SPI0 Flash 50MHz 4-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Wired-OR Topology

SPI0 4-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Wired-OR Topology Diagram
SPI0 Flash 50MHz 4-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Wired-OR Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyFlash 1 & Flash 2: 50 MHz. TPM & EC: 33 MHz.
Flash ProgrammerRequire additional isolation circuitry to protect CPU from back-feed voltage when connect to flash programmer.
EC and CPU branch requirementDelta between BO + M1 + M2 and M6 + M7 shall not exceed 25.4 mm.
Flash branch requirement, M3 + M4SPI branches of segment M3 + M4 need length matching within 2.54mm.
R1[1] DATA: 10 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 15 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
R268 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
R3[1] DATA: 10 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [2] CLK: 15 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK.
R468 5%. To be placed within 12.7 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
Minimum length, total50.8 mm. Min length between CPU to the closest end device = 50.8 mm.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% 1.25 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout 14 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 9 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 50MHz support: Option 2[1] Driver strength spec: 50 or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% 1.45 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time 3 ns. [6] Data input hold time 3 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6.5 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listSPI0_CLK, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_IO2, SPI0_IO3, SPI0_CS0# (for flash1), SPI0_CS1# (for flash2), SPI0_CS2# (for TPM).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx5Total Channel

M4MS, DSL50.8
M5MS, DSL76.2
M6MS, DSL12.7
M7MS, DSL76.2

Min Length Total (mm): 50.8

Min Length Total Note: 1) Min length between CPU to the closest end device = 50.8 mm; 2) Min length on M2, M3 and M6 shall not be < 12.7 mm.

Max Length Total (mm): 152.4

Max Length Total Note: 1) Max length between CPU to Flash = 152.4 mm; 2) Total topology length = 393.7mm.

[For Internal Validation] SPI0 Flash 100MHz 4-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Isolation FET Topology

SPI0 Flash 100MHz 4 Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Isolation FET Topology
[For Internal Validation] SPI0 Flash 100MHz 4-Load Branch (Device Down) with G3 Isolation FET Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max frequencyFlash 1: 100 MHz. TPM and Debug Tool: < 14.3 MHz. EC: 50MHz.
R1[1] 15 5%. To be placed within 25.4 mm from flash device on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3. [1] 10 5%. To be placed within 25.4 mm from flash device on SPI0_CLK.
R2430 5%. To be placed within 5.08 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
Length from CPU to Flash 1Length from CPU to flash 1: = BO + M1 + M2 + M3 + M4
Minimum length, totalBO + M1 + M2 + M3 + M4 = 30.48mm
Routing schemeInterleave 1 CS with every 2 DATA lanes is recommended. Recommend to route DATA and CLK on same layer.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 100MHz support: Option 1[1] Driver strength spec: 40 or stronger across worse case corners. [2] 0.4 ns rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% 1.7 ns based on 30 pF test load. [3] Output capacitance, Cout 16 pF (including RPMC die). [4] Input capacitance, Cin 12 pF (including RPMC die). [5] Data input setup time 1.75 ns. [6] Data input hold time 2 ns. [7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load. [8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
FET component criteriaRon < 4.5 . Cin < 6 pF.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listSPI0_CLK, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_IO2, SPI0_IO3, SPI0_CS0# (for flash), SPI0_CS2# (for TPM)
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx5Total Channel

SVID

SVID 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

SVID 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
SVID 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
VIDSOUT platform resistorsRpu1 = 160 , Rpu2 = 160 , R1 = 10 , R2 = 15 .
VIDSCK platform resistorsRpu1 = Empty, Rpu2 = 82 , R1 = 0 / Short pad, R2 = 15 .
VIDSALERT# platform resistorsRpu1 = 100 , Rpu2 = Empty, R1 = 0 / Short pad, R2 = 0 / Short pad.
Platform resistor tolerance 5%
Resistor Placement Recommendation (Rpu1, R1, Rpu2, R2)The Rpu1 & R1 resistor should be place close to CPU and Rpu2 & R2 resistor should be place close to IMVP controller.
Clarification about Rpu1/ Rpu2/ R1/ R2 = Empty/ 0 / Short Pad[1] Rpu1 or Rpu2 = Empty; The specific side of the trace related to Rpu1 = Empty or Rpu2 = Empty does not need a pull-up resistor to the 1.05V power rail (VDD2H). [2] R1 or R2 = 0 / Short Pad; The signal does not need a series resistor for the specific part on the trace which is being represented by R1 or R2. Be aware, the trace still needs to remain connected end to end. * It is strongly recommended to refer for the implementation on RVP.
Gen5 VRTT tool validation Stuff VIDSOUT R1 with 0 if VIDSOUT signal swing fails VIL with Gen5 VRTT tool.
Maximum trace DC resistance 7
Signal PTH/ via transitionSuggest having a GND stitching vias for each signal transition. The GND stitching vias to the signal vias need to be within 5.08 mm from one another.
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Essential guidelines for routing near switching voltage regulator circuitIt is strongly recommended to meet routing near switching voltage regulator guidelines for SVID signals. Refer to "Switching VR Circuit Guideline" chapter in PDG for the details. (Technical White Paper Doc#: 726825)
Route orderingWhen routing at minimum spacing route ALERT between DATA and CLK.
Length matching between VIDSOUT and VIDSCK 2.54 mm
Signal name/ listVIDSOUT, VIDSCK, VIDALERT#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx6Total Channel
Rx6Total Channel

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Signal MRTS

M1Trace23

R1Resistor35

THC-SPI

THC-SPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology

THC-SPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology Diagram
THC-SPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency42.67MHz (Please contact Intel for higher frequency enabling)
R122 5%, M_cable length >7" 39 5%, M_cable length <7" To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector on THC0_SPI1_CLK, THC0_SPI1_IO[0:3], THC1_SPI2_CLK, THC1_SPI2_IO[0:3].
M_cableRecommended to use shielded cable.
M_cable electrical characteristics-0.075 dB/inch < Insertion loss < -0.052 dB/inch -32.8 dB < Return loss < -46.2 dB -45.4 dB < Crosstalk < -47.2 dB 42 < Impedance < 62
Minimum length, total 129.5 mm
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Devices Electrical AssumptionsPlease refer to "SPI Interface and Electrical Assumptions for the Touch Device" chapter in Intel Touch Host Controller Integration Guide for further detials. (Touch Integration Guide Doc#:778513)
CPU buffer driver strength40 .
Signal name/ listTHC0_SPI1_CLK, THC0_SPI1_IO[0:3], THC0_SPI1_CS#, THC0_RST#, THC0_INT#, THC1_SPI2_CLK, THC1_SPI2_IO[0:3], THC1_SPI2_CS#, THC1_RST#, THC1_INT#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx4Total Channel
Tx4Total Channel
Rx4Total Channel

CPUDevice01

UART0/ UART1 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA/ others signals0.125 mm
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).

NoteDetail
R113 . Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required.

Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
